page.title: 17THE CHURCH-SUTTON ST JAMES
page.content: The tower is about 17 metres high, and can be seen for quite a distance as the surrounding countryside is very flat. In 1878 a lot of work was done to the brickwork which was wearing away, and more recently , a great deal of money had to be raised to repair the church. In 1920 the clock was placed in the tower as a memorial to those killed in the Great War. There is a green in front of the church where a garden fete is held every year. Children from the school dance around the Maypole at the fete.
